001package com.cececandicorner.inventory;
002
003import java.sql.Connection;
004import java.sql.DriverManager;
005import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
006import java.sql.ResultSet;
007import java.sql.SQLException;
008import java.sql.Statement;
009import java.util.ArrayList;
010import java.util.List;
011
012/**
013 * DatabaseManager.java
014 * Manages all interactions with the SQLite database for Cece's Candi Corner Inventory System.
015 * This class handles connecting to the database, creating the table, and performing
016 * CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on the 'bracelets' table.
017 * It encapsulates JDBC logic and handles SQL exceptions.
018 */
019public class DatabaseManager {
020
021    // Database URL prefix for SQLite
022    private String DB_URL_PREFIX = "jdbc:sqlite:";
023    private String dbPath; // Stores the user-provided database file path
024
025    /**
026     * Constructor for DatabaseManager.
027     * @param dbPath The file path to the SQLite database file (e.g., "inventory.db").
028     */
029    public DatabaseManager(String dbPath) {
030        this.dbPath = dbPath;
031        // Load the SQLite JDBC driver. This is typically not strictly necessary for modern JDBC,
032        // but good practice for clarity.
033        try {
034            Class.forName("org.sqlite.JDBC");
035        } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
036            System.err.println("Error: SQLite JDBC driver not found. Make sure sqlite-jdbc.jar is in your classpath.");
037            // You might want to throw a runtime exception here or handle more gracefully
038        }
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Establishes a connection to the SQLite database.
043     * @return A Connection object if successful, null otherwise.
044     * Displays an error message if connection fails.
045     */
046    private Connection connect() {
047        Connection conn = null;
048        try {
049            // dbPath will be something like "C:/path/to/inventory.db"
050            conn = DriverManager.getConnection(DB_URL_PREFIX + dbPath);
051            // System.out.println("Connection to SQLite database established successfully."); // For debugging
052        } catch (SQLException e) {
053            System.err.println("Error connecting to database at " + dbPath + ": " + e.getMessage());
054        }
055        return conn;
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Creates the 'bracelets' table for user if it does not already exist.
060     * Assumes the table schema: id (TEXT PRIMARY KEY), description (TEXT),
061     * quantity (INTEGER), price (REAL), status (TEXT).
062     * @return true if table creation was successful or table already exists, false otherwise.
063     */
064    public boolean createTable() {
065        String sql = "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS bracelets (" +
066                "id TEXT PRIMARY KEY," +
067                "description TEXT NOT NULL," +
068                "quantity INTEGER NOT NULL," +
069                "price REAL NOT NULL," +
070                "status TEXT NOT NULL" +
071                ");";
072        try (Connection conn = connect();
073             Statement stmt = conn.createStatement()) {
074            if (conn != null) {
075                stmt.execute(sql);
076                // System.out.println("Table 'bracelets' checked/created successfully."); // For debugging
077                return true;
078            }
079        } catch (SQLException e) {
080            System.err.println("Error creating table: " + e.getMessage());
081        }
082        return false;
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Inserts a new bracelet into the database.
087     * @param bracelet The bracelet object which is inserted.
088     * @return true if insertion is successful, false otherwise.
089     */
090    public boolean insertBracelet(Bracelet bracelet) {
091        String sql = "INSERT INTO bracelets(id, description, quantity, price, status) VALUES(?,?,?,?,?)";
092        try (Connection conn = connect();
093             PreparedStatement pstmt = conn.prepareStatement(sql)) {
094            pstmt.setString(1, bracelet.getId());
095            pstmt.setString(2, bracelet.getDescription());
096            pstmt.setInt(3, bracelet.getQuantity());
097            pstmt.setDouble(4, bracelet.getPrice());
098            pstmt.setString(5, bracelet.getStatus());
099            pstmt.executeUpdate();
100            return true;
101        } catch (SQLException e) {
102            System.err.println("Error inserting bracelet " + bracelet.getId() + ": " + e.getMessage());
103        }
104        return false;
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Selects all bracelets from the database.
109     * @return A List of bracelet objects, or an empty list if no bracelets found or an error occurs.
110     */
111    public List<Bracelet> selectAllBracelets() {
112        List<Bracelet> bracelets = new ArrayList<>();
113        String sql = "SELECT id, description, quantity, price, status FROM bracelets";
114        try (Connection conn = connect();
115             Statement stmt = conn.createStatement();
116             ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery(sql)) {
117
118            while (rs.next()) {
119                bracelets.add(new Bracelet(
120                        rs.getString("id"),
121                        rs.getString("description"),
122                        rs.getInt("quantity"),
123                        rs.getDouble("price"),
124                        rs.getString("status")
125                ));
126            }
127        } catch (SQLException e) {
128            System.err.println("Error selecting all bracelets: " + e.getMessage());
129        }
130        return bracelets;
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Selects a single bracelet by its ID.
135     * @param id The ID of the bracelet to retrieve.
136     * @return The bracelet object if found, null otherwise.
137     */
138    public Bracelet selectBraceletById(String id) {
139        String sql = "SELECT id, description, quantity, price, status FROM bracelets WHERE id = ?";
140        try (Connection conn = connect();
141             PreparedStatement pstmt = conn.prepareStatement(sql)) {
142            pstmt.setString(1, id);
143            ResultSet rs = pstmt.executeQuery();
144            if (rs.next()) {
145                return new Bracelet(
146                        rs.getString("id"),
147                        rs.getString("description"),
148                        rs.getInt("quantity"),
149                        rs.getDouble("price"),
150                        rs.getString("status")
151                );
152            }
153        } catch (SQLException e) {
154            System.err.println("Error selecting bracelet by ID " + id + ": " + e.getMessage());
155        }
156        return null;
157    }
158
159    /**
160     * Updates an existing bracelet in the database.
161     * @param bracelet The bracelet object with updated values.
162     * @return true if update is successful, false otherwise.
163     */
164    public boolean updateBracelet(Bracelet bracelet) {
165        String sql = "UPDATE bracelets SET description = ?, quantity = ?, price = ?, status = ? WHERE id = ?";
166        try (Connection conn = connect();
167             PreparedStatement pstmt = conn.prepareStatement(sql)) {
168            pstmt.setString(1, bracelet.getDescription());
169            pstmt.setInt(2, bracelet.getQuantity());
170            pstmt.setDouble(3, bracelet.getPrice());
171            pstmt.setString(4, bracelet.getStatus());
172            pstmt.setString(5, bracelet.getId());
173            pstmt.executeUpdate();
174            return true;
175        } catch (SQLException e) {
176            System.err.println("Error updating bracelet " + bracelet.getId() + ": " + e.getMessage());
177        }
178        return false;
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Deletes a bracelet from the database by its ID.
183     * @param id The ID of the bracelet to delete.
184     * @return true if deletion is successful, false otherwise.
185     */
186    public boolean deleteBracelet(String id) {
187        String sql = "DELETE FROM bracelets WHERE id = ?";
188        try (Connection conn = connect();
189             PreparedStatement pstmt = conn.prepareStatement(sql)) {
190            pstmt.setString(1, id);
191            pstmt.executeUpdate();
192            return true;
193        } catch (SQLException e) {
194            System.err.println("Error deleting bracelet " + id + ": " + e.getMessage());
195        }
196        return false;
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * Checks if a bracelet with the given ID already exists in the database.
201     * @param id The ID to check.
202     * @return true if the ID exists, if not then return false.
203     */
204    public boolean doesIdExist(String id) {
205        String sql = "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM bracelets WHERE id = ?";
206        try (Connection conn = connect();
207             PreparedStatement pstmt = conn.prepareStatement(sql)) {
208            pstmt.setString(1, id);
209            ResultSet rs = pstmt.executeQuery();
210            if (rs.next()) {
211                return rs.getInt(1) > 0;
212            }
213        } catch (SQLException e) {
214            System.err.println("Error checking ID existence for " + id + ": " + e.getMessage());
215        }
216        return false;
217    }
218}
